section.title: Removing a Ceph OSD Node

listitem.para: Log in to the OSD node that you wish to remove.
Use the following command to retrieve and make note of the OSD numbers on the OSD node to be removed:
A sample of OSD node is as follows:
listitem.screen: $ ceph osd tree # id weight type name up/down reweight -1 6 root default -2 3 host ceph-ccp-ceph0003-mgmt 0 1 osd.0 up 1 3 1 osd.3 up 1 6 1 osd.6 up 1 -4 3 host ceph-ccp-ceph0001-mgmt 1 1 osd.1 up 1 4 1 osd.4 up 1 7 1 osd.7 up 1 -3 3 host ceph-ccp-ceph0002-mgmt 2 1 osd.2 up 1 5 1 osd.5 up 1 8 1 osd.8 up 1
listitem.para: For example, to remove the OSD node ceph-ccp-ceph0001-mgmt, the OSD numbers 1, 4, and 7 are relevant.
Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Run the following command to stop the OSDs running on the OSD node to be removed:
Replace the <osd_node_to_remove> string with the hostname of the node that you wish to remove. For example 'ceph-ccp-ceph0001-mgmt'.
Log back in to the OSD node you are removing and run the following command for each OSD number (obtained from step #2 above):
listitem.screen: ceph osd out <osd-number> --cluster <ceph_cluster> ceph auth del osd.<osd-number> --cluster <ceph_cluster> ceph osd crush remove osd.<osd-number> --cluster <ceph_cluster> ceph osd rm <osd-number> --cluster <ceph_cluster>

note.para: Replace the string <ceph_cluster> with the name of your Ceph cluster (the default cluster name is ceph).

section.bridgehead: Remove the Ceph OSD Node from Monitoring
section.para: Once a Ceph OSD node has been removed, any related monitoring alarms will trigger. Take the following additional steps to take to resolve this issue.

You will want to SSH to each of the Monasca API servers and edit the /etc/monasca/agent/conf.d/host_alive.yaml file and remove references to the Ceph OSD node(s) you removed. This will require sudo access.
Once you have removed the references on each of your Monasca API servers you then need to restart the monasca-agent on each of those servers with the following command:

With the Ceph OSD node references removed from your Monasca API servers and the corrensponding monasca-agents restarted, you can then delete the corresponding alarms to finish this process. To do so, we recommend using the Monasca CLI, which should be installed by default on each of your Monasca API servers:
section.screen: monasca alarm-list --metric-dimensions hostname=<ceph osd node deleted>
